intro: Racosperma leptospermoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, feathery foliage and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides nectar for native pollinators.
